intro: Zieria commutata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zieria, is a low-growing shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, aromatic leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its foliage is often covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a textured appearance. Zieria commutata is typically found in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
